title: Warning Against False Prophets
shortSummary: Deuteronomy 13 warns the Israelites against false prophets and those who entice them to worship other gods, even if signs or wonders accompany their message. The chapter emphasizes loyalty to the LORD and prescribes severe consequences for those who lead others into idolatry, underscoring God's demand for exclusive devotion.
timeline: c. 1446 BC - Israelite wilderness period, just before entering the Promised Land

keyCharacters.name: Prophet or Dreamer of Dreams
keyCharacters.description: Individuals who claim to speak or reveal signs from God but lead people to worship other gods, thus testing Israel's faithfulness.

keyCharacters.name: Israelite Community
keyCharacters.description: The people of Israel who are being instructed to remain faithful to the LORD and to reject false teachings and idolatry.

keyCharacters.name: Children of Belial
keyCharacters.description: Rebellious men who incite the inhabitants of a city to forsake God and serve other gods, representing internal threats to Israel's covenant faithfulness.

definitions.definition: A person chosen by God to deliver His messages; however, in this chapter, it refers to false prophets who lead people astray.
One who claims to receive divine revelation through dreams, sometimes used to deceive and promote idolatry.
A Hebrew phrase meaning worthless or wicked men who rebel against God and lead others into sin.
A phrase indicating execution by the sword, symbolizing complete and decisive judgment.

outline.heading: Warning Against False Prophets
outline.description: God warns Israel not to follow prophets or dreamers who perform signs but promote idolatry, emphasizing that such individuals must be put to death to preserve covenant faithfulness.

outline.heading: Dealing with Close Relatives Who Entice to Idolatry
outline.description: Even if close family or friends try to lead one to serve other gods, the command is to reject and execute them, demonstrating the seriousness of loyalty to God above all relationships.

outline.heading: Communal Judgment for Idolatry
outline.description: If an entire city turns to idolatry, Israel is commanded to investigate and, if confirmed, to destroy the city completely to remove evil and maintain holiness before God.

application: Remain vigilant against teachings or influences that lead away from exclusive devotion to God, even if they appear convincing or miraculous.
Prioritize obedience to God's commandments over personal relationships when faced with spiritual compromise.
Support church and community efforts to uphold biblical truth and purity, understanding the importance of removing sin from the fellowship.
Trust in God's justice and mercy, knowing that obedience leads to His compassion and blessing.

keyVerses.text: Thou shalt not hearken unto the words of that prophet, or that dreamer of dreams: for the LORD your God proveth you, to know whether ye love the LORD your God with all your heart and with all your soul.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights that God tests His peopleâ€™s love and loyalty, warning against deception even when accompanied by signs.

keyVerses.text: And that prophet, or that dreamer of dreams, shall be put to death; because he hath spoken to turn you away from the LORD your God, which brought you out of the land of Egypt, and redeemed you out of the house of bondage, to thrust thee out of the way which the LORD thy God commanded thee to walk in. So shalt thou put the evil away from the midst of thee.
keyVerses.significance: This verse establishes the severe consequence for leading others into idolatry, emphasizing the need to remove evil from the community.

keyVerses.text: But thou shalt surely kill him; thine hand shall be first upon him to put him to death, and afterwards the hand of all the people.
keyVerses.significance: This verse stresses personal responsibility and communal action in confronting and eradicating idolatry.

keyVerses.text: When thou shalt hearken to the voice of the LORD thy God, to keep all his commandments which I command thee this day, to do that which is right in the eyes of the LORD thy God.
keyVerses.significance: This verse concludes with a call to obedience, promising God's favor and blessing for those who follow His commands.
